title: Stoicism Is Not A Form Of Self-Flagellation
description:
Seneca was a very rich man. He had nice stuff. Critics at the time, and ever since, have found this to be indisputable proof of his hypocrisy. How can a Stoic have expensive ivory tables? Isn‚Äôt it unphilosophical to have multiple houses? Or servants?
